typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.GoldCube: Needs Mana! Connect a mana pipe to it! Colonists love its glow! Provides +10 happiness while running!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.TrainStation: Place next to monorail. Must be powered by mana pipes. Adds a stop for Propulsion Platform to refuel.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Monorail: Rails for Propulsion Platform. Must have at least 1 station to power the Propulsion Platform.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.PropulsionPlatform: Place on monorial. Right click to ride and get off! Stops at stations to refuel. May have more than one per railsystem.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.ManaPump: Mana Pump! Connect a pipe to the front and let it flow! Needs Mana tanks next to, behind or on top of it.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.ManaPipe: Mana Pipe! Connect to a mana pump and add plumbing to mana machines! Mana machines need to be connected to pipes that are connected to a pump!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.ManaTank: Mana Tank! Place next to, on top of or behind a mana pump. Cannot deliver mana with pipes alone. Needs a pump to operate.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.MagicWand: Magic Wand! Used in the repair and creation of magical machines!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Backpack: To use: place it on your toolbar and right click. Your own personal stockpile!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledHelm: Provides 11% damage reduction and 1% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledChest: Provides 30% damage reduction and 1% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledGloves: Provides 7% damage reduction and 1% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledLegs: Provides 13% damage reduction  and 1% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledBoots: Provides 7% damage reduction and 1% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledShield: Provides 12% damage reduction and 1% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledHelm1: Provides 11% damage reduction and 2% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledChest1: Provides 30% damage reduction and 2% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledGloves1: Provides 7% damage reduction and 2% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledLegs1: Provides 13% damage reduction  and 2% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledBoots1: Provides 7% damage reduction and 2% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledShield1: Provides 12% damage reduction and 2% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledHelm2: Provides 11% damage reduction and 3% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledChest2: Provides 30% damage reduction and 3% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledGloves2: Provides 7% damage reduction and 3% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledLegs2: Provides 13% damage reduction  and 3% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledBoots2: Provides 7% damage reduction and 3% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledShield2: Provides 12% damage reduction and 3% skill boost.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.BronzeSword: For taking care of small problems.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledSword: Lop an arm off and 1% skill boost!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledSword1: Lop an arm off and 2% skill boost!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SkilledSword2: Lop an arm off and 3% skill boost!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.PatrolFlag: Used with the Patrol Tool. Tells your knights where to keep watch!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.PatrolTool: Left Click to set patrol points, Right click to create patrol. Left click on existing patrols to change patrol type.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Miner: A good machine! Requires a good supply of wood or coal. Crank to start!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.MachinistBench: Machinists need this bench to repair machines on. The Machinist monitors all machies within 20 blocks of the bench. Only works durning the day.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.NightMachinistBench: Machinists need this bench to repair machines on. The Machinist monitors all machies within 20 blocks of the bench. Only works at night.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.StoneTurret: 50 Physical Damage per shot. Fires a little slower than a Colonist. Same range as colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.BronzeArrowTurret: 100 Physical Damage per shot. Fires a little slower than a Colonist. Same range as colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.CrossbowTurret: 300 Physical Damage per shot. Fires a little slower than a Colonist. Same range as colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.MatchlockTurret: 500 Physical Damage per shot. Fires a little slower than a Colonist. Same range as colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.GateLever: Opens all Iron Gates within 20 blocks of it automatically every morning, and closes them every night. Needs a Machinist to maintain it.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Gate: Iron Gate. Needs a Gate Lever to open.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.ApothecaryTable: Used to make medicines, bandages and magical reagents such as mana.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Anitbiotic: Use on bandages for extra fast healing.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Bandage: Instantly heals for 20 health then heals for 40 health over 5 seconds.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.TreatedBandage: Instantly heals for 50 health then heals for 70 health over 5 seconds.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Mana: Unlocks magical powers! When crafted has a 3% chance to also make Esper.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.TeleportPad: Place 2 to link them. It's that simple! Pick one up and the other will be picked up too! Needs a Machinist to maintain at least one side.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.BuildersWand: Lays out the targeted block. Must have the blocks in your stockpile. Right click to preview, then right click to confirm or Left click to cancel. When not previewing Left click to change modes.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Elementium: Used to make elemental stones and magic items! Has a 3% chance to make Void also.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Esper: Very difficult to capture during the creation of mana. A very powerful reagent for only the most powerful of magical things.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Void: Rare byproduct from Elementium. Who knows all it's uses...
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AirTurret: Air Turret deals 400 air damage and 100 physical damage per shot. Same range as matchlock colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.EarthTurret: Earth Turret deals 400 earth damage and 100 physical damage per shot. Same range as matchlock colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.FireTurret: Fire Turret deals 400 fire damage and 100 physical damage per shot. Same range as matchlock colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.WaterTurret: Water Turret deals 400 water damage and 100 physical damage per shot. Same range as matchlock colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.VoidTurret: Void Turret  deals 400 void damage and 100 physical damage per shot. Same range as matchlock colonist.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.HelpMenu: To use: place it on your toolbar and right click. This will bring up the help menu for the Settlers! mod.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.SchematicTool: To use: place it on your toolbar and right click. This will bring up a menu that can create builder areas that can build and save schematics.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.ServerManagementTool: To use: place it on your toolbar and right click. The server management tool allows you to manage the players on your server!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Sorcerer: Sorcerer crafts magical items for players and colonists.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.Healthbooster: Heals player for 5 health every 5 seconds. The effect stacks. Makes you feel slightly more invincible.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.BootsOfFalling: Causes the wearer to take significantly less fall damage! Inspired by Hermies himself!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.AdamantineNug: A small amount of a rare metal.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.Adamantine: A rare metal. All it's uses are still unknown.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.Selector: Selector Box for the Builders Wand. DO NOT PLACE THIS. WHY DO YOU HAVE THIS? YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.milk: Comes from cows... What are cows?
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.lamp: So torch like yet... so block like!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.ironbar: To house the most dangerous of criminals!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.ironbarcorner: To make those nice turns for your cages
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.infiniteruby: A Tier 2 Economy Block!  So rare!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.infinitesaphi: A super rare Tier 3 Economy Block!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.sandstone: Sandstone is pretty uncommon in this world.  What can you build?
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.limestone: Limestone is pretty interesting.  Ideas flowing?
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.marblepillarb: The bottom of a marble pillar.
How tall do you want it?
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.fencecorner: Corners, for those pesky open spots!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.window: I can show you the world!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.woodsupport: Lifts the weight off your shoulders!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.woodsupportud: Lifts the weight off your shoulders!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.woodsupportcu: Lifts the weight off your shoulders!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.hangingbanner: A dusty hanging banner; with the default Banner Colours!
A dusty hanging banner; in red and white!
A dusty hanging banner; in black and white!
A dusty hanging banner; in cyan and black!
A dusty hanging banner; in blue and white!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.simpletable: A place to put your stuff, without the expense!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.woodencatwalk: When you need a floor, with less resources!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.bench: Perfect for Parks!  And waiting rooms.
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.woodbarrel: A non-functional place to store things!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.cratestack: A pile of non-functional crates, with imaginary storage!
typeuses.Pandaros.Settlers.AutoLoad.crate: A big block-sized crate, for non-functional storage!

GameDifficulty.DifficultyChangeDisabled: The server administrator had disabled the changing of game difficulty.
GameDifficulty.DisabledBelow: The server administrator had disabled setting your difficulty below {0}.

Permission.NotYourColony: You may not build near this colony. Maybe you can ask one of the owners for an invite! The owners are:

System.RestartNeeded: For settlers mod auto update to work, the Colony Survival surver needs to be restarted.

TeleportPad.NeedsRepair: This teleporter is in need of repair. Make sure a machinist is near by to maintain it!
TeleportPad.NeedsMana: This teleporter is in need of mana. Make sure a machinist is near by to maintain it!
TeleportPad.PlaceAnotherTeleporter: Place one more teleportation pad to link to.

Monsters.NoBanner: WARNING: Unable to spawn boss. Please ensure you have a path to your banner. You have been penalized {0} food.

Bosses.AdminDisabledBosses: The server administrator had disabled the changing of bosses.
Bosses.NoColony: You must be near a colony to set its difficulty

Version.UpdateInstalled: Settlers! update {0} installed. Restart server to update!
Version.RestartRequired: Settlers! Has been updated. Restart the server/game to apply.
Version.VersionOutOfDate: Settlers! version is out of date. The mod will automatically update now.

SettlerManager.NewSettlers: settlers would like to join your colony!
SettlerManager.BuyingColonists: Recruiting after {0} colonists will result in {1} happiness debuff per colonists recruited. If you build it... they will come.
SettlerManager.AdminDisabled: The server administrator has disabled recruitment of colonists while settlers are enabled.
SettlerManager.FoodTaken: A colonist has left your colony taking {0} food.
SettlerManager.LeavingNumberOfItems: A colonist has left your colony taking 10% of {0} items from your stockpile.

Settlers.AdminDisabledSettlers: The server administrator had disabled the changing of Settlers.
Settlers.SettlersState: Settlers! Mod Settlers are set to
Settlers.SettlersToggleTime: Settlers! Settlers are set to {0}. You have toggled this {1} out of {2} times.
Settlers.AbuseWarning: To limit abuse of the /settlers command you can no longer toggle settlers on or off. You have used your alloted {0} times.

Knights.NoFlags: You have no patrol flags in your stockpile or inventory.
Knights.CreateJob: Patrol Point number {0} Registered! Right click to create Job.
Knights.PatrolsNotActive: Patrol with {0} patrol points no longer active.
Knights.RoundRobinDescription: The knight will patrol from the first to last point, start over at the first point. Good for circles.
Knights.ZipperDescription: The knight will patrol from the first to last point, then, work its way backwords to the first. Good for patrolling a secion of a wall
Knights.WaitRoundRobinDescription: The knight will patrol from the first to last point, then, work its way backwords to the first.  The knight will wait for monsters to come to them. Good for patrolling a secion of a wall
Knights.WaitZipperDescription: The knight will patrol from the first to last point, start over at the first point. Good for circles. The knight will wait for monsters to come to them.
Knights.MustPlaceFlag: You must place patrol flags using left click before setting the patrol.
Knights.Active: Patrol Active! To stop the patrol pick up any of the patrol flags in the patrol.

BuildersWand.WandMode: Wand mode set to {0}. Charge Left: {1}
BuildersWand.OutOfEnergy: Your Builders wand has Run out of energy and turns to dust in your hands.
BuildersWand.NotValidTopOrBottom: Building on top or bottom of a block not valid for wand mode: {0}.
